data.name: Nearest Exit
data.description:
Find the nearest exit in the maze!

- '0' is an empty space, but 'X' is an impassable wall. 
- You can move up, down, left, or right.
- An exit is an empty space on any of the 4 edges of the maze. 
- You cannot visit a space you have already been to. 
- The starting space does not count as an exit.
- Coordinates are given as `[row_index, column_index]`.
- If multiple exits are nearest, return just one exitâ€”it doesn't matter which one.
- If no valid exit exists, return nil.

The result should be `[row, col]` coordinates of the nearest exit, or `nil` if no exit could be found.

Example:

```
0 0 X X
X 0 X 0
X 0 X 0
```
If the starting position is `[2,1]`, then the nearest exit will be `[0,1]`.

If the starting position is `[0,1]`, then the nearest exit will be `[0,0]`.

If the starting position is `[1,1]`, then the nearest exit will be either `[0,0]` or `[2,1]`.
